intro: Campylocentrum steyermarkii, commonly known as the Steyermark's campylocentrum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of blue to violet bell-shaped flowers. It typically thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
